questions.question: When transitioning from a 1:1 model to a Group Coaching model (L1), what is the 'Critical Mass' threshold recommended to maintain high engagement while maximizing profitability?
options: 5-8 participants per cohort
12-20 participants per cohort
30-50 participants per cohort
100+ participants per cohort
questions.explanation: Lesson 1 highlights that 12-20 participants is the 'sweet spot' for group coaching; it provides enough diversity for community interaction without diluting the coach's ability to provide personalized thyroid oversight.

questions.question: In the context of Designing High-Ticket Thyroid Masterminds (L2), which element is the primary differentiator that justifies a $5,000+ price point?
options: Access to a library of pre-recorded videos
A monthly PDF newsletter
Proximity to the expert and advanced clinical case reviews
A discount on third-party supplements
questions.explanation: High-ticket masterminds are built on 'access and depth.' Clients pay for the expert's direct clinical reasoning and the ability to solve complex thyroid cases that standard programs cannot address.

questions.question: According to Lesson 3, which stage of the B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Method™ workflow is most effectively automated to reduce administrative drag by up to 40%?
options: The 'B' - Baseline Assessment (Intake and Lab Integration)
The 'L' - Lifestyle Intervention (Daily habit coaching)
The 'N' - Nutritional Nuance (Meal planning)
The 'E' - Evaluation (Final exit interview)
questions.explanation: Automating the 'Baseline' phase through integrated intake forms and automated lab upload triggers allows the coach to focus on analysis rather than data entry, significantly increasing operational efficiency.

questions.question: What is the primary strategic purpose of a 'Low-Ticket Tripwire' product in a Digital Product Suite (L4)?
options: To generate the majority of the business's net profit
To fund the cost of lead acquisition (Ads) and segment the 'buyers' from 'browsers'
To replace the need for high-ticket coaching entirely
To provide a comprehensive cure for Hashimoto's in 7 days
questions.explanation: A tripwire (usually $27-$97) is designed to convert a lead into a customer immediately, covering ad spend and identifying individuals willing to invest in their health.

questions.question: When building Clinical Referral Networks (L5), what is the most effective way to present your value proposition to a functional medicine physician?
options: Asking them to pay you a commission for every patient referred
Providing a 1-page clinical summary of your B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Method™ outcomes
Offering to take over their primary diagnosis duties
Sending them generic marketing brochures
questions.explanation: Physicians value data and time. A clinical summary showing improved patient compliance and lab stabilization makes you a valuable asset to their practice's outcomes.

questions.question: In Lesson 6, what is identified as the 'First Critical Hire' for a thyroid coach reaching the $150k ARR (Annual Recurring Revenue) mark?
options: A second Thyroid Health Coach
A full-time Registered Dietitian
An Operations Manager or Virtual Assistant (VA)
A dedicated Sales Closer
questions.explanation: To scale, the founder must move out of the 'Admin Zone.' Hiring an Operations Manager or VA to handle scheduling and client support is the first step to scaling impact.

questions.question: Which Funnel Architecture (L7) is best suited for selling a $2,000+ Thyroid Transformation Program to a 'Cold' audience?
options: A direct-to-checkout sales page
A 5-day email sequence with no video
A Webinar/VLS (Video Lead Sales) funnel leading to a discovery call
A simple Instagram DM strategy
questions.explanation: High-ticket items require high trust. A webinar or VSL allows the coach to demonstrate expertise and the B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Method™ framework before the client commits to a high-investment call.

questions.question: When pitching Corporate Wellness programs (L8), which statistic from the lesson should be used to highlight the 'Cost of Inaction' for employers?
options: Thyroid issues affect 1 in 1,000 people
Untreated thyroid dysfunction results in a 15-20% decrease in cognitive productivity (Brain Fog)
Most employees do not like thyroid medication
Thyroid coaching is a fun team-building exercise
questions.explanation: Corporates care about the 'Bottom Line.' Highlighting the 15-20% productivity loss due to cognitive symptoms (brain fog) creates a financial incentive for the company to hire a specialist coach.

questions.question: A 'Self-Liquidating Lead Magnet' (L4/L7) is successful if:
options: It makes $10,000 profit per month
The revenue from the small offer equals the cost of the ads used to promote it
It is given away for free to 1,000,000 people
It requires at least 10 hours of coaching time per week to maintain
questions.explanation: A lead magnet 'self-liquidates' when the initial sale covers the marketing costs, essentially allowing the coach to acquire new leads and potential high-ticket clients for $0.

questions.question: Case Study Application: Sarah is a coach with a waitlist of 30 people but no more time for 1:1 sessions. According to the Scaling & Growth module, what should be her immediate next move?
options: Stop taking new clients and raise her 1:1 prices by 5%
Hire a social media manager to get more leads
Launch a 'Beta' Group Program using the B.A.L.A.N.C.E. Method™ to transition the waitlist
Build a 50-module passive income course immediately
questions.explanation: Sarah has 'Proof of Concept' and 'Demand.' A Beta Group Program allows her to serve the 30 people on her waitlist simultaneously, increasing her hourly rate and testing the group dynamics before full automation.
